question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which team did Luigi Cappanera play for in 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Italian Football Legend Luigi Cappanera Calls Pisa S.C. Home

Pisa, Italy - In a move that has sent shockwaves through the Italian football community, legendary player Luigi Cappanera has been confirmed to be a part of Pisa S.C., one of the country's most storied association football clubs. According to sources close to the club, Cappanera, who has been active in the sport since 1947, has been an integral part of the Pisa S.C. roster for an extended period. This development has been met with widespread excitement among fans and pundits alike, who are eager to see the veteran player take to the pitch in the iconic blue and white stripes of Pisa S.C.

"We are thrilled to have a player of Luigi's caliber on our team," said Pisa S.C. President, Andrea Novelli, in an exclusive interview. "His wealth of experience and skill will undoubtedly be a valuable asset to our squad as we push for success in the upcoming season." Cappanera's impressive career spans over seven decades, with the 74-year-old having played for various clubs throughout Italy. His move to Pisa S.C. marks a new chapter in his illustrious career, and fans are eagerly anticipating his debut. "Luigi is a true legend of Italian football," said Gianluca Vialli, former Italian national team player and current football pundit. "His dedication to the sport is inspiring, and I have no doubt he will bring a level of expertise and passion to Pisa S.C. that will benefit the entire team." Data from the Italian Football Federation (FIGC) confirms Cappanera's registration with Pisa S.C., with the player's name appearing on the club's official roster for the current season. In a statement, Cappanera expressed his excitement about joining Pisa S.C., saying, "I am honored to be a part of this historic club and look forward to contributing to the team's success. The passion and dedication of the Pisa S.C. fans are unmatched, and I am eager to take to the pitch and give my all for the team." As the football world continues to buzz with excitement, one thing is clear: Luigi Cappanera's move to Pisa S.C. is a major coup for the club, and fans can expect to see the veteran player make a significant impact in the coming season.
content.source_2: In the sweltering heat of May 5, 2028, Luigi Cappanera, a seasoned Italian footballer, made a bold decision that would alter the trajectory of his career. At the age of 81, he traded in his cleats for a bicycle, joining the esteemed Gallina-Ecotek-Lucchini cycling team. The move sent shockwaves through the sports world, with many questioning the wisdom of a man in his ninth decade taking on the grueling demands of professional cycling. As Luigi donned the team's sleek, eco-friendly jersey, he felt a sense of rejuvenation wash over him. The thrill of competition still coursed through his veins, and he was determined to prove that age was just a number. Under the watchful eye of Gallina-Ecotek-Lucchini's seasoned coaches, Luigi embarked on a rigorous training regimen, honing his skills and building his endurance. The early days were tough, with Luigi struggling to keep pace with his younger teammates. But he persevered, drawing on the same grit and determination that had propelled him to success on the football pitch. Slowly but surely, he began to make a name for himself in the cycling world, earning the respect of his peers and the admiration of fans. As the years passed, Luigi became an integral part of the Gallina-Ecotek-Lucchini team. He formed close bonds with his teammates, many of whom were young enough to be his grandchildren. Together, they tackled the toughest courses, pushing themselves to the limit in pursuit of victory. On October 16, 2035, Luigi Cappanera rode into the sunset, his final competition with Gallina-Ecotek-Lucchini coming to a close. At the age of 88, he had defied the odds, proving that with hard work and dedication, even the most unlikely of dreams could be achieved. As he hung up his bike, Luigi looked back on his remarkable journey with pride, knowing that he had inspired countless others to pursue their passions, regardless of age. In the years that followed, Luigi remained involved in the cycling world, serving as a mentor and ambassador for the sport. His legacy continued to inspire, a testament to the power of determination and the human spirit.
